criterion: Reward for precisely documenting the combined oral contraceptive prescription: 20 µg ethinyl estradiol / 100 µg levonorgestrel, one tablet daily at the same hour with no break (last seven placebo), starting tonight, 28-day pack.

Reward for capturing refill/cost logistics: six-month prescription queued at Harbor Pharmacy, new voucher required every 28 days, patient must request Form K manufacturer coupon each time, pharmacy can fax form to clinician.
Reward for including explicit instructions on missed pills (<12 h late: take as soon as remembered; >12 h late: take immediately then another at usual time next day and use condoms for 7 days).
Reward for documenting common side-effects (spotting first 2–3 packs, mild nausea, breast tenderness) and serious warning signs (severe leg pain or chest pressure).

Reward for noting additional clinical advice: expected spotting guidance (call if soaking >1 pad/hour), use of ibuprofen only for breakthrough cramps, and suggestion to set a daily phone alarm for adherence.
Reward for reflecting patient concerns/questions about daily timing with late work shifts, bleeding history, fear of missed-dose consequences, and medication cost.

Reward for appropriately incorporating relevant chart context (age 26 female; existing conditions dysmenorrhea and irregular menstruation; current meds ibuprofen and same OCP) without introducing unrelated chart items.
Reward for overall completeness: note captures all major clinician instructions, patient questions, and agreed plans with coherent structure.
Penalize for introducing fabricated or extrapolated clinical content not present in transcript or chart (e.g., additional diagnoses, labs, physical exam findings, alternative dosages).
Penalize for inaccurate transcription of numerical or medication details (e.g., wrong hormone micrograms, incorrect missed-dose window, wrong backup duration).
Penalize for selectively or wholesale copying irrelevant chart data unrelated to the encounter (e.g., family history placeholders, generic template text).
Penalize for omission or significant distortion of any key clinician instruction or patient concern identified above, resulting in an incomplete or misleading note.
